channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Reddit community revives the holiday spirit after popular Secret Santa events end
item.description: Swapping presents with strangers on the internet is a favorite pastime for many Reddit users. After two popular holiday gift exchanges ended, bereft m...

item.title: Are you contagious? Here's when you're most likely to spread COVID, flu, RSV
item.description: How long are you contagious after getting COVID, flu, RSV, pneumonia and more? Here's what to know to keep others safe this holiday season.

item.title: Gaetz ethics report says his drug use, sex with a minor violated state laws
item.description: A report by the House Ethics Committee found former Rep. Matt Gaetz paid multiple women, including a 17-year-old girl, for sex.

item.title: Undocumented people are among most vulnerable to climate-infused disasters
item.description: Many undocumented people are not eligible for federal financial disaster aid and several remain fearful even when help is offered.

item.title: 'May love rest gently in your broken heart': What to say to a grieving friend
item.description: When a good friend's loved one passes away, it can be hard to find the right thing to say. NPR readers share words of comfort they've shared with othe...

item.title: Biden commutes sentences of 37 of 40 federal death row inmates
item.description: President Biden is granting clemency to 37 of the 40 federal inmates facing death sentencesâ€‹. Their sentences will be commuted to life in prison witho...

item.title: Health care AI, intended to save money, requires expensive humans
item.description: Despite the hype over artificial intelligence in medicine, the systems require consistent monitoring and staffing to put in place and maintain.

item.title: The new right celebrates Trump at a conservative conference and sidesteps inconsistencies
Watch: Abseiling Santa descends from Guatemala bridge to deliver toys
item.description: A firefighter dressed as Santa abseils down a bridge in Guatemala City to give gifts to children.

item.title: Abortion opponents shift focus to pills with lawsuits, proposed laws and possible federal action
The Refugees Trapped in a Corner of Syria, Now Free
item.description: In a remote corner of southeastern Syria near the border with Jordan, some 7,000 people have been trapped in a refugee camp for more than nine years. ...

item.title: Slovak PM meets Putin in unannounced Moscow visit
item.description: Robert Fico is only the third EU leader to visit Moscow and believes Putin has been demonised by the West.

item.title: Watch: 90-year-old with Parkinson's enters weightlifting contest
item.description: The woman lifted 45kg with family cheering her on, at a contest organised for the elderly in Taipei.

item.title: What the Israel-Hezbollah war did to Lebanon's cultural heritage sites
item.description: Part of a Crusader castle crumbled. An 18th century minaret felled. Church mosaics burned. Archaeologists are assessing damage to UNESCO World Heritag...

item.title: Honda and Nissan announce plans to merge
item.description: Honda and Nissan have announced plans to merge, forming world's third-largest automaker by sales as the industry transitions away from fossil fuels.

item.title: Watch: BBC reporter returns to childhood home destroyed in Syria civil war
item.description: Feras Killani grew up in Yarmouk in Damascus, which saw brutal fighting between rebel and government forces.

item.title: Many Americans have come to rely on Chinese-made drones. Now lawmakers want to ban them
item.description: The economic and technological rivalry between the U.S. and China has come to the drone market, where Chinese-made flying devices are a dominant playe...

item.title: Woman dies after being set on fire on New York subway
item.description: An arrest is made after a woman is set alight on a Brooklyn train by a man she was not thought to know.
